dev.title: Dev Commands
dev.content:
This is the developer command. This area is for testing and debugging.
>> You can edit the file to develop new modules.
>> Usage: 'dev'

config.title: Config Editor
config.content:
This command allows you to edit the runtime config files.
>> You can select keys, Add new objects (string with key, only string, array or dict), delete or edit existing objects.
Usage: config

help.title: Help
help.content:
This Command shows informations about the commands in this project.
>> Give a command to see the informations for this command only.
Usage: help <command>

backup.title: Backup
backup.content:
This Command creates a Backup of the entire Project.
Usage: backup

restore.title: Restore
restore.content:
This Command allows you to restore from a backup in the 'Backups/' folder.
Usage: restore

setup.title: Config Setup
setup.content:
This is a system module for setting up the config on fresh install.
Usage: run setup

clear.title: Clear
clear.content:
This Command clears the console.
Usage: clear

run.title: Run
run.content:
This Command runs a command from the command list.
It is mostly used to execute the project commands.
Usage: run <command> <args>

reload.title: Reload
reload.content:
This util reloads the project when changes are made in the script, without closing the script.
Usage: reload

network.title: Network
network.content:
This is a Project. Supplies a menu for some network commands like sftp, ssh and other things done in the network.
Usage: run network

listjson.title: ListJson
listjson.content:
This Command lallows you to see the 'runtime-config' that is loaded, (for developer purposes only).
Usage: listjson <op_Attribute>
Example: listjson paths

rsync.title: Rsync
rsync.content:
This is a Project. Runs a menu for rsync options.
>> RSYNC is a efficient way to copy/move files. Also allows moving data via network.
Usage: run rsync

ytdl.title: YTDL
ytdl.content:
This is a Project. Downloads Videos from URL/s.
Works with youtube, and other websites ;)
>> Make sure that you have setup the 'ytdl_save_paths' in the 'paths/media' config!
Usage: run ytdl

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.content:
This project runs a menu that allows you to perform different actions for metadata of videos and images.
>> Also allows to remove metadata from multiple files at once (blk-remove).
Usage: run metadata

cyberdrop.title: Cyberdrop-dl
cyberdrop.content:
This is a Project. Runs a external Menu for downloading media from sites like simpcity.
https://github.com/Jules-WinnfieldX/CyberDropDownloader/releases
Usage: run cyberop

dupeyeet.title: dupeyeet
dupeyeet.content:
This is a Project. Runs a menu that let's you scan Mediafiles like Images and Videos in a folder for duplicates and automatically remove them.
Usage: run dupe

mediaconvert.title: Media Convert
mediaconvert.content:
This is a Project. Runs recursive trough the given folder, looking for *mkv* files, using a FFMPEG Docker Container to convert them into *mp4* files..
Usage: run mediaconvert

blkrename.title: Bulk Renamer
blkrename.content:
This is a Project that let's you rename all files of a specific type at once, either with a random name or your own (ending with a number).
Usage: run blkrename <op:/path/to/folder/>

cmd.title: Command Execution
cmd.content:
This is a project that allows you to run saved command in the console, out of the project.
Usage: run cmd

filemanager.title: File and Folder Manager
filemanager.content:
This is a project, that allows you to browse trough your data and manage files and folders
Usage: manager
